close_symbols: struct MHD_Daemon (definition and fields: shutdown, options, itc, listen_fd, was_quiesced, connections, connection_limit, at_limit)
explanation: For checking MISRA rule (no use of memcmp to compare null‑terminated strings) you must inspect all functions and macros called directly by MHD_select because memcmp could appear there.  - resume_suspended_connections: called early and may itself call string/comparison routines; must be checked for memcmp use.  - internal_get_fdset2: called to build fdsets; implementation must be checked for any memcmp use.  - MHD_DLOG: logging routine (used under HAVE_MESSAGES); its implementation or formatting helpers could use memcmp-like string comparisons.  - MHD_add_to_fd_set_: helper used to add sockets to fdsets; inspect for memcmp usage.  - MHD_get_timeout64: called to obtain timeouts; check its implementation (it may call other helpers that compare strings).  - internal_run_from_select: post‑select dispatch; must be inspected for any memcmp usage that would be exercised from MHD_select.  - MHD_SYS_select_: platform wrapper around select; include to confirm no hidden string comparisons.  - MHD_socket_get_error_, MHD_SCKT_ERR_IS_EINTR_, MHD_socket_strerr_: socket error helpers; string formatting/error string routines may use memcmp.  - MHD_itc_r_fd_, MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_: inter‑thread control helpers/macros used in conditionals and fd handling; macros could expand to code using comparisons.  - MHD_INVALID_SOCKET, MHD_NO, MHD_YES, MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME, MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_: constants/macros that affect control flow; their definitions/macros should be known in case they expand to expressions that invoke comparison helpers.  - FD_ZERO, FD_SETSIZE: fd_set macros/constants used in calls; include to rule out macros that may expand to routines using memcmp.  - struct MHD_Daemon and listed fields: the structure definition (and the types of its fields) is needed to see whether any field access triggers inline helpers or macros that perform string comparisons.  - struct timeval and _MHD_TIMEVAL_TV_SEC_TYPE, TIMEVAL_TV_SEC_MAX, SIZEOF_UINT64_T, SIZEOF_STRUCT_TIMEVAL_TV_SEC: time‑related types/macros used to compute timeouts; include to check for any helper macros that might use memcmp or string routines.  In short: every direct callee, any wrapper/macros used in conditionals or calls, and the data types/macros referenced by MHD_select must be examined to be certain no memcmp is used (directly or indirectly) to compare null‑terminated strings in the execution paths taken by MHD_select.
